net.proteusframework.cms.controller.ckeditor

Interface Connector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectorImpl

    public interface Connector
    Connector for CKEditor.

    If you return directories or files with aliased names, make sure you implement resolvePath(ConnectorContext, String).

    To allow Javascript code to easily determine if a path represents a file or a folder, folder must end with a slash, "/", and files must not end with a slash. If you use FileInfoImpl's automatic property setting, this is handled automatically.

    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@proteus.co)

        Get the children of a folder.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context.
        depth - the depth to retrieve files. 0 or greater. Implementations must support a depth of 1 at minimum. 0 indicates infinite depth.

      • resolvePath

        java.lang.String resolvePath(ConnectorContext ctx,
                             java.lang.String path)
        Resolve a path substituting any aliases.

        The ConnectorContext.getCurrentWorkingDirectory() may not be available when this is called since this method may be used to resolve the path to determine the CWD. Implementations of this method should check the CWD for null if needed.

        Parameters:
        ctx - the context.
        path - the path.
        Returns:
        the resolved path.

      • writeCKEditorConfig

        void writeCKEditorConfig(ConnectorContext ctx,
                         java.io.PrintWriter out)
        Write the CKEditor config for the specified context. CKEditorConfigBuilder can be used to help write out the javascript config.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context.
        out - the output stream.
